info.title: eBaoCloud LI OpenAPI
info.description:
This document is the API specification for the eBaoCloud Life part. To practice and run the APIs in this document, you need to apply an eBaoCloud tenant accout(start from a sandbox account instead of production) first.
Contact liliang.zhu@ebaotech.com for more information and trial using. # Built on Thu Sep 14 2017, 11:29:20 +07:00 # Versioning API version| Date |Comments --|---|-- 0.5 | 2017-06-13 | Init version 0.6 | 2017-06-19 | Add new category and readme 0.6.5 | 2017-06-29 | oauth2 document, Chinese version document 0.8 | 2017-07-07 | oauth2 lanuch 0.8.5 | 2017-07-31 | Enhancement in product services 0.9 | 2017-08-25 | Add limits related APIs (age, premium / SA and term ) 0.9.5 | 2017-09-05 | Add new service for e-policy downloading 0.9.6 | 2017-09-13 | Add field: extra premium # Authentication ## Overview eBaoCloud offers 3rd party applications the ability to issue authenticated requests on behalf of the eBaoCloud itself. eBaoCloud's implementation is based on the [Client Credentials Grant](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-4.4) flow of the [oauth 2 specification](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749). ## Auth Flow The oauth2 / token authentication flow follows these 3 major steps: 1. An application (backend) encodes its consumer key and secret (provided by eBaoCloud as an authorized vender) into a specially encoded set of credentials. 2. An application (backend) makes a request to the POST oauth2 / token endpoint to exchange these credentials for a bearer token. 3. When accessing the REST API, the application (the APP or website) uses the bearer token to authenticate. ![Auth Flow](/assets/oauth.png) ## Step by step * Send request to auth end point ```js POST: /cas/ebao/v1/json/tickets Body: {"username":"name", "password":"pwd"} Response: {"access_token": "xxxx"} ``` * Send request with access_token in header ```js POST: /rest/products Header: { "authorization":"Bearer "+access_token, "X-ebao-tenant-id": "tenant-id" } ``` ## End Points | | Sandbox | Production | | :--- | :--- | :--- | | auth / take token | [https://sandbox.ebaocloud.com.cn/cas/ebao/v1/json/tickets](https://sandbox.ebaocloud.com.cn/cas/ebao/v1/json/tickets) | [https://ebaocloud.com.cn/cas/ebao/v1/json/tickets](https://ebaocloud.com.cn/cas/ebao/v1/json/tickets) | | APIs | [https://sandbox.gw.ebaocloud.com.cn/li/eBao/1/](https://sandbox.gw.ebaocloud.com.cn/li/eBao/1/) | [https://gw.ebaocloud.com.cn/li/eBao/1/](https://gw.ebaocloud.com.cn/li/eBao/1/)| ## Sample #### Request auth from application ```bash curl --request POST \ --url https://url/cas/ebao/v1/json/tickets \ --header 'content-type: application/json' \ --header 'X-ebao-tenant-id: tenant-id' \ --data '{\n \n "username":"site.admin",\n "password":"adminPWD!"\n}' ``` Note: . the **X-ebao-tenant-id** is the unique id provided by eBaoCloud to identify the tenant. . the **username** and **password** are provided by eBaoCloud when you registered as an authorized vendor. #### Response from API GateWay * Success ```js { "access_token" : "TGT-233-e7Zuc5FlSAa0SShO3B1f2iugYzRQGQrSSoGwAi0VnWbnBNDwHg" } ``` * Failed ```js { "access_token" : null } ``` #### App call (Java code sample) ```java HttpResponse response = Unirest.post(url) // url：the UAT/product URL .header("content-type", "application/json") // application/json .header("authorization", "Bearer " + accessToken) // oauth2 access token：the accessToken .header("X-ebao-tenant-id", "tenant-id") .body(body) // body: http body .asString(); ``` ## Others ### Tokens are passwords Keep in mind that the consumer key & secret, bearer token credentials, and the bearer token itself grant access to make requests on behalf of an application. These values should be considered as sensitive as passwords, and must not be shared or distributed to untrusted parties. ### SSL required All requests (both to obtain and use the tokens) **must use** HTTPS endpoints.

tags.name: Product
tags.description: Product related services, including product and pacakge information retrieve, pricing and illustration calculations.

age.description: Policy holder's age on application date. At least capture one of the age or birthday.  When have both age and birthday, using birthday as the calculation base.

birthdate.description: Insured's birthday, non-empty, date format: yyyy-MM-dd

medicalIndi.description:
Whether there is medical insurance coverage
Y - yes
N - no

occupationCode.description: Occupation code, provide by insurer officially. For some product, this field is compulsory

orderId.description: Insured sequence, for only one insured, this number is 1

smoking.description:
Whether smoking, Y - yes;
N - no
By default is no smoking

socialSecurityIndi.description:
Whether there is social medical insurance coverage
Y - yes
N - no

premType.example: 2: regular premium; 3: regular topup; 4: ad-hoc topup

pricingMethod.description:
Premiums calculation method
0 - premium/SA by the user input
1 - products sold by the unit
2 - calculate premiums base on sum assured, but also allows the agreement premium
3 - products sold under the plan or unit
4 - products are only allowed to sell according to plan
5 - according to the premium , But also allow the agreement premium
6 - only to allow the sum assured to premium but also allow the agreement premium
7 - only allow premiums to sum assured
8 - both sum assured to premium or sum assured to premium

benefitLevel.description: Benefit level, only apply to the products which sales by benefit level

paymentFreq.description:
Pay frequency
1 - yearly payment
2 - half yearly payment
3 - quarterly payment
4 - monthly payment
5 - single premium

premium.description: Premium, only for the calculate SA from premium

sumAssured.description: SA, when the premium calculation is from SA to premium.

unit.description: Unit, only apply to the product which sales by unit

benefitType.description:
Product benefit category
22 - Reimbursement medical insurance
23 - subsidised medical insurance
31 - accident insurance
11 - endowment insurance
12 - annuities insurance
13 - life insurance
14 - term insurance
41 - investment insurance
15 - mortgage insurance
16 - long-term care
17 - critical illness

highAgeMonth.description: The maximum age allowed of the insured

limitUnit.description:
Insured or unit limit
1 - insured amount
2 - unit

lowAgeMonth.description: The minimum age allowed of the insured

maxAmount.description: The maximum amount, the amount of SA, or the unit

minAmount.description: The minimum amount, the amount of SA, or the unit

attachMode.description:
Product relationship type:
1 - 共存关系
2 - 依赖关系
3 - 互斥关系

parentCateId.description: Product sales category's parent category Id

ageBase.description:
Age calculation method
1 - according to the age of insurance
2 - according to the year of the annual anniversary of the policy

unitFlag.description:
Premiums calculation method
0 - premium/SA by the user input
1 - products sold by the unit
2 - calculate premiums base on sum assured, but also allows the agreement premium
3 - products sold under the plan or unit
4 - products are only allowed to sell according to plan
5 - according to the premium , But also allow the agreement premium
6 - only to allow the sum assured to premium but also allow the agreement premium
7 - only allow premiums to sum assured
8 - both sum assured to premium or sum assured to premium

waiver.description: Whether it is a waiver plan

chargePeriod.description:
Charge period type
1 - Single payment
2 - pay next few years
3 - pay till a certain age
4 - pay for whole life
If the product supports payment peroid, this field is compulsory

chargeYear.description:
Payment period
When payment period type = 1, the field is meaningless
When payment period type = 2, this field represents years
When payment period type = 3, this field represents the age
When payment period type = 4, this field represents months

coveragePeriod.description:
Coverage type
1 - whole life
2 - per year
3 - Cover to a certain age
4 - per month
5 - per day

coverageYear.description:
Coverage period
When coverage period type = 1, the field is meaningless
When coverage period type = 2, this field represents years
When coverage period type = 3, this field represents the age
When coverage period type = 4, this field represents months

insureds.description: Product premium calculation, insured related information

waivedSa.description: Waived SA, only apply to the waiver product

insuredAge.description: The age limit of the insured person

applyDate.description: Application date, non-empty, date format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss

deliverType.description:
Policy delivery method
H - by people
M - by mail

coverageYear.description:
Coverage Term. Meaning of this property is associated with property "coveragePeriod" ("type" for short). when covers whole life, value of this property is 9999;
and if type is 2, means years covered;
and if type is 3, means age when coverage expired;
and if type is 4, means months covered;
and if type is 5, means days covered.

Coverage Term. Meaning of this property is associated with property "coveragePeriod" ("type" for short). when covers whole life, value of this property is 9999;

and if type is 4, means months covered;
and if type is 5, means days covered.
